column4: ive had startupmanager also 'break' the grub config. So use it with caution
I only have ubuntu on this machine lol
at least i justlearned about a new command for grub2 -->  sudo grub-set-default  "Windows Vista (loader) (on /dev/sda1)"
now windows is the default. :)  if i wanted to reboot to windows. i could sort of make a script for that.
This is a good resource for grub if you've not seen it. http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1195275
thats one i pasted earlier I think. :)
i got most of them bookmarked on my Delicious account  http://delicious.com/dr_willis/grub2
i was just rereading that thread - they keep updating it. :)
This is more annoying: Your browser is no longer supported.
ive had it say to upgrade to the latest flash when i was using the beta of flash
ahh. encrypted homes.. :) im NOT using that.
still - i dont think the gnome keyring would be used for that.  what if you tried some other window manager. :)
sun-java6 in partner repo is version 6.20
What if one is set to auto login and you switch users?
i was trying to look that up. :) i knew it was some easy name..  but not in /media/ like one would expect.
